title: Ticket #1115: Remove Target scope from EvalBool() in new ClassAds
description:
The free-standing function EvalBool() takes a ClassAd and an unparsed expression string, and returns true if the parsed expression evaluates to True. One of its oddities is that it uses the ClassAd as the target scope of the evaluation and no ad for for the local scope. Most callers use expressions with no 'Target' scope for the attribute references, which works fine in old ClassAds, but not new ClassAds.

In the new ClassAds compatibility layer, we will change EvalBool() to use the provided ClassAd as the local evaluation scope and have no target scope. For the few cases where an expression may have a 'Target' scope (older condor_q querying a newer schedd), EvalBool() will call the new RemoveExplicitTargetRefs() to strip off the 'Target' scoping.

The old ClassAds version of EvalBool should be left alone.
